cards.subject: English
cards.back: The specific words a writer uses, and the meanings and associations they carry.
cards.use: In RUAE, define word choice and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: How sentences are built and used (length, type, order, punctuation) to create an effect.
cards.use: In RUAE, define sentence structure and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: The writer’s attitude or feeling, shown through language and style.
cards.use: In RUAE, define tone and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: Language that creates a clear picture or sensory impression in the reader’s mind.
cards.use: In RUAE, define imagery and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: A deliberate difference between ideas or details used to highlight a point.
cards.use: In RUAE, define contrast and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: Marks (such as commas, colons and dashes) used to organise writing and shape meaning.
cards.use: In RUAE, define punctuation and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: The level of formality in language, chosen to suit purpose and audience.
cards.use: In RUAE, define register and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: The literal, dictionary meaning of a word.
cards.use: In RUAE, define denotative meaning and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: The implied meanings or associations a word suggests beyond its literal meaning.
cards.use: In RUAE, define connotative meaning and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: A deliberate method a writer uses to communicate ideas and create effect.
cards.use: In RUAE, define technique and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: A noticeable part of a text (language or structure) that contributes to meaning and effect.
cards.use: In RUAE, define feature and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: The writer’s use of words and expression to communicate meaning.
cards.use: In RUAE, define language and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: The overall way a text is written, including language choices and sentence patterns.
cards.use: In RUAE, define style and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: A conclusion you draw from evidence in the text, rather than something stated directly.
cards.use: In RUAE, define inference and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: A brief account of the main points, without extra detail.
cards.use: In RUAE, summary tells you what kind of answer to give.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: What the writer is trying to achieve (inform, argue, persuade, entertain, etc).
cards.use: In RUAE, define purpose and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: The readers or listeners the writer is aiming at.
cards.use: In RUAE, define audience and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: A line of reasoning supported by evidence, used to persuade or explain a viewpoint.
cards.use: In RUAE, define argument and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: Designed to influence the reader’s views or actions.
cards.use: In RUAE, define persuasive and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: A judgement about how effective a text or technique is, backed by evidence.
cards.use: In RUAE, define evaluation and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: The impact a word, technique or structure has on the reader.
cards.use: In RUAE, define effect and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: The surrounding circumstances that help explain meaning (situation, audience, time, genre).
cards.use: In RUAE, define context and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: A connection between parts of a text. In RUAE it often means explaining how a sentence ties back to a previous idea and sets up the next.
cards.use: In RUAE, define link and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: The central point a paragraph or text is making.
cards.use: In RUAE, define main idea and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: Specific information from the text that backs up an answer (quotes, details, examples).
cards.use: In RUAE, define supporting evidence and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: Pick out and name the relevant point or feature.
cards.use: In RUAE, identify tells you what kind of answer to give.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: Give reasons or make clear how something works, usually with evidence from the text.
cards.use: In RUAE, explain tells you what kind of answer to give.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: Point to a specific part of the text to support your answer.
cards.use: In RUAE, define reference and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: A direct lift from the text used as evidence.
cards.use: In RUAE, define quotation and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: Express the idea using different wording, without copying the original phrasing.
cards.use: In RUAE, own words tells you what kind of answer to give.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: Say what a feature does and why it matters, backed by evidence.
cards.use: In RUAE, comment on tells you what kind of answer to give.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: The writer’s stance or feeling towards a subject, shown through tone and language.
cards.use: In RUAE, define attitude and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: How a text is arranged on the page or screen (headings, paragraphs, visuals).
cards.use: In RUAE, define layout and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: A specific instance used to support a point.
cards.use: In RUAE, define example and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: A short story or personal example used to illustrate a point.
cards.use: In RUAE, define anecdote and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: A figure of speech where something is described as if it is something else to create meaning or emphasis.
cards.use: In RUAE, define metaphor and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: A statement that can be proven true or false.
cards.use: In RUAE, define fact and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: A viewpoint or judgement that cannot be proven in the same way as a fact.
cards.use: In RUAE, define opinion and show it with a short quote or reference.

cards.subject: English
cards.back: A one-sided perspective that favours a particular view.
cards.use: In RUAE, define bias and show it with a short quote or reference.
